channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Two bags of earth dumped on the corner of Gibson Street and Old Woolwich Road, 19th September
item.description:
If your team could pick these up I’d be grateful. Thanks Chris

item.title: Overgrown shrub, 19th September
item.description:
Overgrown shrub outside number 30-28 sholden gardens needs cutting back and all weeds bellbind ivy cut back and clears as it’s getting into my nice maintained garden
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 41, Rookery Gardens, Poverest, London

item.title: Sumner road and Jowett Street full of litter, 19th September
item.description:
Sumner Road from Daniel garden till Jowett Street (included) is full of litter on the street and pavement. Particularly concerning is in front of the Jowett Street recreation ground full of health hazards with dirty gloves and sanitary stuff. This is next to a nursery! Please clean it asap

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Jowett Street, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street sign on the ground again, 19th September
item.description:
This was “fixed” recently. I saw this in action, it was obvious that it would not last, the ground needs digging out by at least a foot, it was merely propped up.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Station Approach Path, Well Hall, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping - bringing multiple truck loads, 19th September
item.description:
Old building merchants site next door to 258 Green Lanes. Two men with the Range Rover are unloading multiple loads of fly tipping - sofas, household goods etc. They’ve also brought an old caravan to the site. Urinating on site too.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Green Lanes, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.category: Graffiti / Flyposting on stop or shelter (non-offensive)

item.title: Leaning tree, 19th September
item.description:
It looks as though a tree in grace avenue by the back fence of number 12 hyde road/grace avenue has been hit by a van or lorry and all the casing, wooden stakes are now broken away and the tree is leaning over the pavement. Can this please be looked into and can the tree be propped back up.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 12, Grace Avenue, Barnehurst, London
Report on FixMyStreet
